channel.title: Speeding up EV charging | Graphene permeability discovery | Thin film solar cell with flexible substrate | Electrolyte design for batteries | Generating electricity from organic hydrides | Plus products
channel.description: In this issue: Unravelling graphene's proton permeability

item.title: Cooling methods for electronic equipment
item.description: Excessive heat in equipment reduces its service life and adversely impacts its performance. Proper selection of cooling elements can help avoid these negative effects.

item.title: SCHURTER Sets New Benchmark in Reducing CO2 Footprint with Latest Product — Green Line
item.description: As part of SCHURTER's sustainable strategy, the IEC 60320-1 appliance connectors contribute to less CO<sub>2</sub> emissions and lower material consumption.

item.title: Q&A: Mark Burr-Lonnon on the future of the electronics industry
item.description: Mark Burr-Lonnon from Mouser Electronics describes coming trends in the electronics industry, such as artificial intelligence, automation, and IoT.

item.title: Unravelling graphene's proton permeability
item.description: Researchers have demonstrated that perfect graphene crystals are permeable to protons, as the protons are expedited around nanoscale wrinkles in the crystal.

item.title: Suppressing lithium plating in batteries for fast-charging EVs
item.description: A new way to prevent lithium plating in electric vehicle (EV) batteries could lead to faster charging times, according to researchers from the UK.

item.title: Transparent thin-film solar cell developed with flexible substrate
item.description: Researchers have developed a transparent thin-film solar cell on a flexible substrate that displays various reflective colours without reducing solar cell efficiency.

item.title: Framework developed to guide electrolyte design for batteries
item.description: Researchers have developed a framework that can guide the design of electrolytes for advanced batteries.

item.title: Generating electricity from MCH using solid oxide fuel cells
item.description: Researchers from Waseda University in Japan have successfully generated electricity from methylcyclohexane (MCH) using solid oxide fuel cells.

item.title: Electronex 2024
item.description: The event will be held in Sydney, from 19â€“20 June 2024. Design, develop and manufacture using the latest solutions.

item.title: STMicroelectronics STM32H5 microcontroller
item.description: The STMicroelectronics STM32H5 microcontroller houses up to 2 MB of dual bank Flash and up to 640 KB of RAM. It also offers a CORDIC and FMAC accelerator.

item.title: Helios Power Solutions medical power supplies
item.description: The medical power supplies offered by Helios Power Solutions feature robust thermal and EMC design and the opportunity for customisation.

item.title: Advantech AIMB-592 motherboard
item.description: The Advantech AIMB-592 motherboard leverages AMD EPYC 7003 Series Processors to deliver high computing power and support GPU extension.

item.title: Hammond Electronics 1557 IP68 wall mount/desktop plastic enclosures
item.description: The Hammond Electronics 1557 family of wall mount/desktop enclosures features an IP68 environmental sealing that enables the unit to be installed in any environment.

item.title: Unlocking Next-Gen Industrial Power: IEI's DRPC-W-EHL, The Pinnacle of Fanless Embedded Systems Performance.
item.description: IEI's DRPC-W-EHL embodies unmatched resilience, combining Intel's prowess with rugged design, ensuring optimal performance even in the most challenging industrial environments.

item.title: Custom Enclosure Design
item.description: Discover excellence in custom enclosures! From electronics to specialized equipment, our skilled team meets your unique needs. Contact Erntec today to witness the difference firsthand.
